articles.title: Michael Flynn posts video featuring QAnon slogans
articles.description: In a video posted online over the weekend, President Donald Trump's first national security adviser, Michael Flynn, is seen using phrases and slogans that are hallmarks of the baseless QAnon conspiracy movement. He also tagged his post with a QAnon hashtag.

articles.author: Sandee LaMotte and Lauren Mascarenhas, CNN
articles.title: 'Silent spreaders' may be responsible for half of Covid-19 cases, study finds
articles.description: People with no obvious symptoms of Covid-19 -- called "silent spreaders" -- may be responsible for half of the Covid-19 cases in the US, a new study has found.

articles.title: Atlanta mayor says increase in shootings stems from 'perfect storm of distress'
articles.description: Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms said Tuesday the increase in shootings and murders in the city and across the country is the result of a "perfect storm" of frustration, the coronavirus pandemic and issues with police brutality.

articles.title: FDA warns against using 5 more hand sanitizers found to contain methanol
articles.description: The US Food and Drug Administration has added five hand sanitizers to its list of products that have tested positive for a toxic chemical.

articles.author: Virginia Langmaid and Judson Jones, CNN
articles.title: A new comet is now visible with the naked eye
articles.description: A newly-discovered comet dubbed NEOWISE will be visible this week to the naked eye. It's the first visible comet of 2020.

articles.title: Trump administration informs Congress it is withdrawing from World Health Organization
articles.description: The Trump administration has notified Congress that it is formally withdrawing the United States from the World Health Organization amid the coronavirus pandemic, multiple officials tell CNN.

articles.author: Analysis by Chris Cillizza, CNN Editor-at-large
articles.title: The Point: This Kentucky Democrat may be the key to the Senate majority
articles.description: Amid all of the grilling and fireworks, you may have missed a development that could fundamentally impact the fight for the Senate majority this fall: Amy McGrath beat Charles Booker to win the Kentucky Democratic primary.
articles.content:
THE POINT -- NOW ON YOUTUBE! 
In each episode of his weekly YouTube show, Chris Cillizza will delve a little deeper into the surreal world of politics. Click to subscribe!

articles.author: Wayne Sterling
articles.title: Opening night Major League Soccer match is postponed due to positive Covid-19 tests
articles.description: Major League Soccer's MLS is Back Tournament match between Nashville SC and Chicago Fire FC has been postponed, the league announced in a statement.

articles.title: CNN host opens up about his long battle with virus
articles.description: CNN's Richard Quest describes the persisting Covid-19 side effects he continues to suffer from, despite the fact that he has recovered from the virus after being infected in April.

articles.title: Airlines bookings start to tumble again as coronavirus cases spike
articles.description: Airline travel is bouncing back -- but so are American coronavirus cases. That spike could put the aviation rebound in reverse.

articles.title: EPA approves two Lysol products as the first to effectively kill novel coronavirus on surfaces
articles.description: Lysol Disinfectant Spray and Lysol Disinfectant Max Cover Mist meet the EPA's criteria for use against the coronavirus based on laboratory testing that found both products kill the virus two minutes after contact, the agency announced in a statement Monday.
